member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch
member.summary:
State of single reload batch. Include description of relevant [externally] changed files, resulting project /solution actions (such reload).
IVsSolutionReloadBatch is free-threaded object and can be used without switching to UI thread.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.BatchId
member.summary: Batch id - unique withing solution open session.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.LastChangeId
member.summary: Last state change id. Each call to TryAddXXX might change the state if introduce a new reload action or new changed files hint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.Stage
member.summary: Note if BatchStage != COMPLETED, the state can be changed at any time. Only the IVsSolutionBatchUpdateManagerEvents event listeners are guaranteed to have stable data in this case

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.HandlerId
member.summary: batch handler friendly id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.HasSolutionReload
member.summary: batch require solution reload.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.BatchTask
member.summary: VS task tracking batch progress.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.RequestComplete
member.summary: VS request batch completion as soon as possible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.RequestCancel
member.summary: VS request batch cancellation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.DisableChangeNotifications
member.summary: Needed to support original solution external file changes handler behavior. This will only apply while batch is active.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.IsFilesChanged(System.UInt32,System.String[],System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Check the requested files against batch state (based on aggregated changes files via TryAddChangedFiles).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.GetProjectsAction(System.UInt32,System.Guid[],System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Check the status of a projects

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.TryAddSolutionReload
member.summary: Request solution reload

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.TryAddProjectsReload(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Request specific projects reload, fForceReload applies to all specified projects. Note even if reloadAction = DRA_ReloadProject [some of] selected projects can still end up being forcefully reloaded (even if they support own reload) if some other logic requires that for same project[s]. If fForceReload = DRA_ForceReloadProject, it is guarantee that they will be forcefully reloaded (unless solution is reloaded which will override any project reloads).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch.TryAddChangedFiles(System.UInt32,System.String[])
member.summary: Add files changes hints (can be used by reload logic extender during compute stage).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler
member.summary: State of single reload batch. Include description of relevant [externally] changed files, resulting project /solution actions (such reload).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.HandlerId
member.summary: friendly HandlerId. it is string instead of usual guid for better readability. We don't publish any predefined values. this scenario is always an arm race, so if specific provider wants details they need to discover them.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.CanGiveControl(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler)
member.summary: check current provider if it will allow giving up control to a different reload handler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.CanTakeControl(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler)
member.summary: check if provider can/want take control and handle the currently opened scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.CanJoin(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler)
member.summary: check if provider is ok to join the currently opened scope and let existing handler drive it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.CanCommitBatch(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: called on BG thread when a state changed, or handler instructed us (via timeout).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.CanCommitBatchUI(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: called on UI thread before commencing modal reload phase.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatchHandler.ExecuteReloadUI(Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadBatch,System.UInt32,System.Guid[],System.UInt32[])
member.summary: commence the actual reload, once this is called no additional changes can be included in batch scope and it will be closed (one way or another) after this method finish. In theory we can support async, but all current cases do require UI thread anyway (and it is unlikely we want to change that).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_ReloadProject
member.summary: Project to be reload (closed and opened) if needed, Example: project file[s] change. If project can not handle external change, it will be reloaded by solution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_ForceReloadProject
member.summary: Project to be reload (closed and opened) for this batch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_ReloadSolution
member.summary: Force solution reload, supersedes any other actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_AddProject
member.summary: Project to be added to the solution for this batch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_RemoveProject
member.summary: Project to be removed from the solution for this batch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_RenameProject
member.summary: Project to be renamed in the solution for this batch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop._DelayedReloadAction.DRA_UpdateProjectParent
member.summary: Project parent to be changed in the solution for this batch.

member.summary: IVsSolutionReloadManager implementation service id.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadManager
member.summary:
Manages external changes that are resolved to project[s] reload. Provides batching and ability to specialize reload logic.
IVsSolutionReloadManager is free-threaded service and can be called from any thread without switching to UI thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadManager.Unadvise(System.UInt32)
member.summary: The IVsSolutionReloadManagerEvents can be used to both react on reload changes as well as influence the outcome.

member.summary: Start a reload batch scope
member.param: pExecutor is the batch commit handler. can be null in which case we use the current or default one.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Internal.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionReloadManager.AddSolutionReload
M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Designer.Interfaces.IVSMDPerPropertyBrowsing.GetPropertyAttributes(System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the list of attributes for the object.
member.param: The dispid of the property to retrieve attributes
the number of attribute type names in

Attribute type names, such as System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute, or System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute. This can be the name of any type that derives from System.Attribute. The array is callee allocated and will be caller freed using . Strings themselves should be freed with . It can also be a static instance name such as System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.No, which will cause the initializer value to be ignored.

An array of variants to be used to initialize the given attributes. If the attributes have a ctor that takes a parameter, the given argument will be used to iniitalize the attribute. If the initializer is NULL, VT_EMPTY or VT_NULL, the default ctor will be called. Variants will be caller freed individually by pInvoking VariantClear. The array must be freed calling .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsProvideAsyncSaveState.GetAsyncSaveState
member.summary: Returns a state object (such as a checkpoint) for an async save operation.
member.remarks: This method is called at the beginning of an asynchronous save. A docdata can implement this interface and supply a state object. It can retrieve the state object in its implementation of or by calling IVsAsyncRunningDocumentTable.GetAsyncSaveState.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsyncRunningDocumentTable
member.remarks: This interface is safe to access from any thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsyncRunningDocumentTable.SaveDocumentsAsync(System.UInt32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsProgress)
member.summary: Saves one or more documents asynchronously.
member.param: The save options

The hierarchy that owns the document to save, or null. This parameter is only used if is VSCOOKIE_NIL and is not VSITEMID_SELECTION. In that case, if this parameter is non-null, then the document identified by is saved.

The item identifier for the document to save, or VSITEMID_SELECTION. This parameter is only used if is VSCOOKIE_NIL. In that case, if this value is VSITEMID_SELECTION then all selected documents are saved. If this value is not VSITEMID_SELECTION and is non-null, this value must be something other than VSITEMID_NIL.
The cookie for the document, or VSCOOKIE_NIL. If this parameter is not VSCOOKIE_NIL, and are ignored and the document identified by the cookie is saved.
The interface through which progress is reported.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation

remarks.para: If is VSCOOKIE_NIL, is not VSITEMID_SELECTION, and is null, all dirty documents are saved.
This method is safe to access from any thread.

member.param: The provider of the state object.

remarks.para: This method is called from a docdata's implementation of or to fetch the state object supplied by in its implementation of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsProjectAsyncOpen.OpenItemAsync(System.UInt32,System.Guid,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously opens an item in the project.
member.param: Identifier of the item to open. Should be VSITEMID_ROOT or other valid item identifier. See the VSITEMID enumeration.
Unique identifier of the logical view. If not GUID_NULL, indicates a specific type of view to create. For more information, see the LOGVIEWID.
If true, then the environment will use the doc data object obtained from the Running Document Table; otherwise, the service will open the document using the doc data passed in to .
A reference to the document data object of the item to open or null. This value passed into this parameter is ignored if is true.
member.returns: A task representing the open operation. The result of the task is an for the opened item.
member.remarks:
By implementing IVsProjectSpecificEditorMap2 interface on your project object, you can do project-specific handling of files. That is, you can support either opening the file in a project-specific editor or allowing the global editor to open the item. Opening an item requires launching an editor using OpenStandardEditorAsync(...) or OpenSpecificEditorAsync(...), depending on the handling you want to implement. For more information, see GetSpecificEditorProperty.
NOTE: In your implementation of , do not call Show() on the window frame you return.
Compare to
The task returned by this method does not indicate that the document's view and docdata have been loaded. See for more details.

member.param: Identifier of the item to open. Should be VSITEMID_ROOT or other valid item identifier. See the VSITEMID enumeration.

member.returns: A task representing the reopen operation. The result of the task is an for the reopened item.
member.remarks:
Similar to except that you call OpenSpecificEditorAsync (rather than the OpenStandardEditorAsync).
Implement to handle automatic reopening of files that belong to a project. For example, when a user adds files to a project type that you created, closes the project and later reopens it, implement to also open the files that belong to the new project type.
The task returned by this method does not indicate that the document's view and docdata have been loaded. See for more details.

member.summary: Opens a file using the standard editor. It will first determine whether a default editor factory for the file is already configured. If a default is not already configured, then it will loop through a priority-sorted list of editor factories to find the first one that supports the document. An exception is thrown if the document cannot be opened.
member.param: Flags whose values are taken from the or enumeration.

remarks.para: The task returned by this method does not indicate that the document's view and docdata have been loaded. See for more details.

This method uses the result of to determine whether it should continue looping to the next editor in the list to find a supported editor factory. Specifically, it should return one of the following: 1. S_OK to indicate that it should stop looping if the editor supports the file and was successfully initialized 2. "VS_E_UNSUPPORTEDFORMAT" to indicate that it should continue looping if the editor does not support the provided doc data 3. Any other error code to indicate that it should stop looping.
This method must be accessed on the main thread.

member.summary: Finds an appropriate project to open the document.

true if the project supports external items; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A task representing the open operation. The result of the task is an object.

remarks.para: The task returned by this method does not indicate that the document's view and docdata have been loaded. See for more details.

This can be called to open any project that is opened through the New Project or Open Project dialog box. In addition, this method is also called to open a document in any project that is added to the solution through or . One example use of this is the DataView hierarchy, which is currently in Server Explorer. If a DataView hierarchy is added to the solution as a virtual project using , then this method can open items from DataView hierarchies. This functionality is important as it makes debugging of stored procedures possible.
This method must be accessed on the main thread.

This method is used by VSPackages that are not projects that need to open a document in a specific editor, but do not care which project opens the file. To call this method from your VSPackage, you need to know exactly which editor factory you want and exactly which window you want the editor factory to create (that is, the physical view). The logical view specified in the parameter further allows you to specify which tab should be displayed by the editor if the editor implements .
This method calls . If no project can service the file and the Miscellaneous Files project is not already present, the environment then creates the Miscellaneous Files project and tries again.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsAsyncShellOpenDocument.GetProvisionalViewingStatusForFileAsync(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.UInt32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the provisional viewing status for a file.
member.param: The name of the file.
The hierarchy of the item.
The item identifier of the item.
The logical view to query.
member.returns: A task representing the query operation. The result of the task is a member of the enumeration that describes how the file can be opened in the preview tab. The default provisional viewing status is PVS_Disabled, but can be modified by the editor's "CommonPhysicalViewAttributes" registry value and the values under its "PhysicalViewAttributes" registry subkey.

remarks.para: The physical view attributes which declare if and how the physical view supports provisional viewing (that is, previewing) are properties of the editor. In addition to physical view attributes, editors also declare what file types they can edit (for example, *.cs, *.xml, and so on) and the relative rank of the editor. Multiple editors can declare that they support the same file type and the environment then chooses the one with the highest rank to open the file.
This method must be accessed on the main thread.

member.summary: The UI context is unknown to the system. This means it has never been set. Unknown UI contexts are implicitly considered to have a state of . member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.UIContextState.Inactive
member.summary: The UI context is set to an inactive state.
